availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Stephen T. Drane (Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, farmer. Shelby County native. Son of Stephen Drane and Priscilla Sprague Crabb Drane. Married to Birthia Ford Drane on April 28, 1828. Father of Albert G. Drane, Meritt Drane, Leonard Drane, and William Drane. Justice of the peace in Shelby County. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Shelby County from 1856 to 1857. Farmer in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 46.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #000259285.
W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State, 8th ed. (Louisville and Chicago: F. A. Battey and Company, 1888), 784-85.
Find A Grave, "Stephen Tillett Drane, Jr (January 25, 1808-July 16, 1893)," Memorial #28936928, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28936928 (accessed August 1, 2018).
